course_title: Special Topics in Philosophy: Theories of Black Sexuality

class_notes:
(Same as AAS 385 4, CPLT 389 5)
Does (black) sexuality have an ontological destiny? Can sexuality provide the resources to answer the question "who am I"  "Does blackness problematize the relation between sexuality, identity, and being? Is "queerness" a generative analytic for blackness or a conceptual impasse? Our aim in this seminar is to understand the architecture of black sexuality - gender, sex, sexual difference, and identity. The seminar will investigate the interstitial relation between blackness and sexuality - understanding sexuality as a matrix of violence and, also, a field of self-fashioning. The readings are primarily theoretical/philosophical, including texts by Hortense Spillers, Saidiya Hartman, Tommy Curry, Denise Ferreira da Silva, Jennifer Nash, Marquis Bey, among others.
